result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cynthia R. Mangold

defendant.name: Mangold, Cynthia R.
defendant.address: 8231 Old Green Bay Rd, Pleasant Prairie, WI 53158

records.addlTxt:
2:08 PM Attorney Daniel Joseph Tombasco in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Cynthia R. Mangold in court.  Attorney Xavier Solis in court for Cynthia R. Mangold. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: DE is rejecting the State's offer. Both parties are ready to proceed to trial. Court begins to hold Ludwig hearing, but takes a recess at 2:14 pm to allow DE to speak with Attorney Solis off the record regarding the State's offer in the conference room.

Back on the record at 2:37 pm. Same appearances. Attorney Solis states the matter is now resolved as the DE would like to accept the State's offer. Attorney Solis is requesting a plea/sentencing date. Trial date is removed from the calendar.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
State's List of Witnesses and Demand for Discovery

09:55 AM  Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State. Defendant, Cynthia R. Mangold, appeared with Attorney Xavier Solis.   Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES:  Victim rights compliance. Attorney Solis has an offer and is requesting additional time to discuss offer with the DE before she decides to reject/accept the offer from the State. Attorney Solis can advise the Court if the DE is rejecting the offer at the jury status hearing on 10/5/22 at 1:30 pm. Court leaves on for next scheduled court activity.

State appears by Attorney Alexander Huber. Attorney Xavier Solis in court with Defendant Cynthia R. Mangold.  Clerk: PU
 Minutes:  DE has no objection to proceeding before Judge Gabriele today.  Case is not resolved and Atty Solis requests an adjournment for further discovery and negotiations.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury selection scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Atty Xavier Solis appointed Advocate Counsel (copy mailed to DE)
and Order sent to Br. 6 for review

re: Judicial rotation mailed to DE

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Edward M. and Gavin M.

01:24 PM  
  Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Chad Shamali.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  The Court finds probable cause in this case today.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 09:50 am.  Jury selection scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.  $500  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).    jk
and witness list filed by the State
